doc.previous: Geordie consonants generally follow those of Received Pronunciation The dialect is non rhotic like most Anglo English dialects This means speakers do not pronounce r unless it is followed by a vowel sound in that same phrase or prosodic unit The rhotic sound r in Geordie is pronounced as Some phonological characteristics of consonants specific to Geordie are listed as follows
